note: Faint loop CME first distinguishable as a coherent front to the SW in SOHO LASCO C2 at 2025-06-01T18:00Z. There is no clear source in available UV imagery. There are several extremely faint, outflow-like fronts seen to the SW around this time. This front is the most cohesive and is visible in SOHO LASCO C2/C3, STEREO A COR2, and GOES CCOR-1.

cmeAnalyses.note: Best fit measurement using several frames of SOHO LASCO C3, STEREO A COR2, and GOES CCOR-1.

note: Narrow faint loop CME to the southwest in both coronagraphs (SOHO LASCO and STEREO A COR2). Not clearly seen in GOES CCOR-1. Its start could be earlier but no clear front is seen in SOHO LASCO C2. No clear source has been found for this CME.

cmeAnalyses.note: Approximate analysis based on the fit with two coronagraphs, as no clear source has been found.

note: A series of multiple fronts to the northwest seen in both coronagraphs. Its source is an eruption behind the northwest limb seen as opening of field lines behind the limb in SDO AIA 193 starting at 2025-06-02T06:51Z. This eruption is also seen in EUVI STEREO A 195 on disk, close to the northwest limb (N15W68 in STEREO A) as dimming and post-eruptive arcades around 2025-06-02T07:05Z.

cmeAnalyses.note: Measurement based on the best fit between SOHO LASCO C2/C3 and STEREO A COR2 imagery in SWPC_CAT.

note: The more western, faint lobe of the CME: 2025-06-13T:25Z. The front of this faint western lobe is very faintly seen only in SOHO LASCO C3 coronagraph (mostly in running difference imagery), while it is covered by the data gap in STEREO A COR2. Not clearly seen in GOES: CCOR-1.

cmeAnalyses.note: The CME/CME lobe is only seen (and faintly) in SOHO LASCO and no clear source has been found for this CME, so only plane-of-sky measurement is possible for it.

note: CME visible to the N in SOHO LASCO C2/C3 and GOES CCOR-1, and slightly to the NE in STEREO COR2. The source is uncertain, but may be a wide area of slowly opening field lines visible in the NW portion of the Earth-facing disk, centered at approximately N50 and extending from W90 to possibly as far as E10 (it is difficult to tell given the faintness of the field line movement on the disk) as seen in GOES SUVI 284 starting as early as 2025-06-02T11:30Z. Analysis of this CME was affected by a data gap in STEREO A COR2 which lasted from 2025-06-02T23:53Z to 2025-06-03T00:53Z.

cmeAnalyses.note: Best fit measurement using multiple frames of SOHO LASCO C3 and two usable frames of STEREO A COR2. Analysis of this CME was affected by a data gap in STEREO A COR2 which lasted from 2025-06-02T23:53Z to 2025-06-03T00:53Z, resulting in there being two usable frames before the tracked feature exited the STEREO A COR2 field of view.

note: A slow CME to the northeast in SOHO LASCO C2/C3, GOES CCOR-1 and STEREO A COR2, seen more brightly in COR2A and appearing as a faint partial halo in CCOR-1. Its start time could possibly be even earlier, but the clear front is seen closer to 2025-06-03T07:48Z. Its source could be an eruption of a filament in the north/northeast, seen in SDO AIA 193/304 and EUVI A 195/304/284 starting at ~2025-06-03T01:21Z. Initial dimming and faint post-eruptive arcades are centered around ~(N20E01), but later the dimming is seen migrating/expanding eastwardly through the rest of the morning, and settling on a large circular area centered ~N35E15 by 2025-06-03T12:20Z.

cmeAnalyses.note: Analysis of the first closed loop front (not the initial dimpled/broken/fuzzy front) based on the best fit with two coronagraphs (SOHO LASCO and STEREO A COR2). This analysis is approximate, as longitude of the fit can vary from -17 to 27 degrees.

note: Narrow faint CME/outflow to the northeast in STEREO A COR2 and to the NNE in SOHO LASCO C3. Not clearly visible in GOES:CCOR-1. No source has been found for this event.

cmeAnalyses.note: Approximate analysis based on the fit of this narrow CME in two coronagraphs (SOHO LASCO C3 and STEREO A COR2). No source was found for this event, however it is worth noting that the CME latitude and longitude are just north of the recently opened coronal hole which was gradually 'opened' by a very slow motion eruption associated with the 2025-06-03T07:48Z CME.

note: Narrow very faint CME with a fuzzy front seen to the northeast in SOHO LASCO and STEREO A COR2 coronagraphs and obscured by the pylon in GOES CCOR-1. Its source is the filament eruption centered ~(N23E45) starting at 2025-06-04T10:17Z as seen in SDO AIA 193/304 as dimming and as opening of field lines on the northeast limb in STEREO A EUVI 195.

cmeAnalyses.note: Approximate analysis based on the fit of the fuzzy faint front in two coronagraphs (SOHO LASCO C2 and STEREO A COR2).

note: Faint, diffuse CME visible to the NE in SOHO LASCO C2, C3, and STEREO A COR2 imagery. Not clearly seen in GOES CCOR-1. The source may be associated with a quick eruption and field line movement from an area near N12E60 as seen in SDO/AIA 193 starting around 2025-06-04T17:15Z.

cmeAnalyses.note: Parameters based on best fit in SOHO LASCO C2 and STEREO A COR2 imagery. The parameters may vary by +/- 10 degrees due to the faintness of the CME.

note: Bright CME first seen in the Northeast by SOHO LASCO C2 beginning at 2025-06-05T08:12Z, as well as by SOHO LASCO C3, STEREO A COR2 and GOES CCOR-1 in later frames. The source of this event is a far sided filament eruption seen faintly in GOES SUVI 304. Field line movement is also visible along the NE limb in SDO AIA 171, 193, 211 and GOES SUVI 284.

cmeAnalyses.note: Measurement based on approximate source location and best fit between SOHO LASCO C2/C3 and STEREO A COR2.

note: CME seen to the south in SOHO LASCO C2/C3 and GOES CCOR-1, and to the southeast in STEREO A COR2. The source is nearly continuous, gradual, and wide field line movement seen on and near the south limb of the Earth-facing disk as seen in SDO AIA 171 and GOES SUVI 284. This eruption is preceded by a slower outflow of material which was similar in appearance, though more diffuse, and sourced from at or near the same location near the southern limb of the Earth-facing disk.

cmeAnalyses.note: Best fit measurement using several frames of SOHO LASCO C3 and STEREO A COR2 running difference imagery.

note: Extremely faint jet CME visible to the northwest in SOHO LASCO C2/C3, GOES CCOR-1, and STEREO A COR2. The leading edge is extremely diffuse. The source is associated with narrow field line opening seen on the NW limb around N35 which traces to either to a small area of post-eruptive brightening seen at N35W75 in SDO AIA 171 starting at about 2025-06-06T08:21Z or possibly to beyond the NW limb. Very subtle field line movement in the vicinity of N35W75 can also be seen in STEREO A EUVI 195, but there are several subtle instances of field line movement in the area of the disk, therefore it is difficult to identify an exact source.

cmeAnalyses.note: Plane-of-sky measurement was using four frames of STEREO A COR2 imagery, before the leading edge becomes too diffuse to track. After several attempts, the leading edge of this CME is not reliably trackable in SOHO LASCO C3, C2, or in GOES CCOR-1; the leading edge is too diffuse or is not discernable in the imagery. The leading edge is visible and reliably trackable for a few frames in STEREO A COR2.

note: Faint and wide CME to the northeast in SOHO LASCO C2/C3, GOES CCOR-1, and STEREO A COR2. Source is an eruption centered near N12E37 starting around 2025-06-06T10:50Z, as seen in SDO AIA 131, 171, 193, 304 and GOES SUVI 284 imagery.

cmeAnalyses.note: Best fit measurement using triangulation between SOHO LASCO C3 and STEREO A COR2 and source location seen in UV imagery of the disk. This CME was partially obstructed by the pylon in GOES CCOR-1.

note: This CME is visible to the northeast in SOHO LASCO C2/C3, STEREO A COR2, and GOES CCOR-1 imagery. The source is likely related to a large dimming region centered near N10E40 which begins to appear around 2025-06-08T01:00Z as seen in SDO AIA 171 and 193 imagery.

cmeAnalyses.note: Measurement based on the approximate source location and best fit between SOHO LASCO C2/C3 and STEREO A COR2 imagery.

note: This CME is visible to the south in SOHO LASCO C2/C3, GOES CCOR-1, and STEREO A COR2 imagery. The source is likely related to a filament eruption visible beyond the southwest limb in SDO AIA 304 imagery which hovers for a few hours before lifting off around 2025-06-08T05:00Z.

cmeAnalyses.note: Measurement based on the best fit between SOHO LASCO C2/C3 and STEREO A COR2 imagery.

note: This CME is visible to the northeast in SOHO LASCO C2/C3, GOES CCOR-1, and STEREO A COR2 imagery. The source is likely related to an eruption visible near the northeast limb starting around 2025-06-08T12:30Z as seen in SDO AIA 304 imagery.

cmeAnalyses.note: Measurement based on the approximate source location and best fit between SOHO LASCO C2 and STEREO A COR2 imagery.

note: This CME is faint but visible to the west/southwest in SOHO LASCO C2 imagery for a few frames before becoming too diffuse to observe. Not clearly visible in STEREO A COR2 or GOES CCOR 1. The source is likely far-sided as there are no source signatures on the Earth-facing disk around the time of this event.

cmeAnalyses.note: A plane-of-sky measurement was made using a longitude of 90 degrees due to the uncertain source location.

note: CME first seen to the NE in SOHO LASCO C2 starting at 2025-06-08T21:36Z. CME is also seen to the NE in SOHO LASCO C3 and GOES CCOR-1. CME is seen to the NNE in STEREO A COR2 for two very faint frames. There is some significant deflection toward the N later into the propagation through the FOV of SOHO LASCO C3. The source of this CME is like an eruption from over the NE limb visible in SDO AIA 304 beginning around 2025-06-08T21:22Z. The eruption is also seen as moving field lines from beyond the NE limb in SDO AIA 171. The CME is overlapped at the back by later CME: 2025-06-08T22:12Z.

cmeAnalyses.note: Measurement based on triangulation between SOHO LASCO C2/C3 and one faint frame in STEREO A COR2 as well as visible source location over the NE limb.

note: CME first seen to the W in SOHO LASCO C2 starting at 2025-06-08T21:48Z. CME also seen to the W in SOHO LASCO C3, GOES CCOR-1, and STEREO A COR2. There is likely some deflection early in the propagation into the FOV of SOHO LASCO C2. The source of this CME is likely a loop seen rising from beyond the W limb and some moving field lines best seen in SDO AIA 171 beginning around 2025-06-08T20:27Z.

cmeAnalyses.note: Measurement based on triangulation between SOHO LASCO C2/C3 and STEREO A COR2 as well as visible source beyond the W limb. The couple of visible frames in COR2A help with triangulation, but the front itself is not defined enough to be used in the measurement.

note: Very narrow (less than 10 degree half-width) jet-like CME visible to the E in SOHO LASCO C2 starting at 2025-06-08T21:48Z. 2025-06-08T22:00Z chosen as start time to distinguish from CME to the W. The jet-like CME is only visible for four frames in running difference imagery from SOHO LASCO C2. There is no definitive source candidate on the Earth-facing disk.

cmeAnalyses.note: Plane-of-sky measurement based on four faint frames of running difference imagery from SOHO LASCO C2. Plane-of-sky measurement chosen due to lack of definitive source candidate.

note: CME first seen to the NE in SOHO LASCO C2 starting at 2025-06-08T22:12Z. CME is also visible to the NE in SOHO LASCO C3 and GOES CCOR-1. CME is not seen in STEREO A COR2. The beginning of this CME is obscured by the earlier, faster CME: 2025-06-08T21:36Z. There is no good source candidate on the Earth-facing disk, so the source is possibly far-sided. It is also possible that the source is related to some continued outflow following CME: 2025-06-08T21:36Z.

cmeAnalyses.note: Plane-of-sky measurement chosen due to lack of STEREO A COR2 imagery and lack of visible source.

note: CME first seen to the E in SOHO LASCO C2 starting around 2025-06-08T22:24Z. CME also seen to the E in SOHO LASCO C3 and GOES CCOR-1. CME is not seen in STEREO A COR2. The start time is somewhat ambiguous as the CME does not become clearly defined until it reaches the edge of the FOV of SOHO LASCO C2. CME is much more easily distinguished in running difference imagery. There is not a good source candidate on the Earth-facing disk, so the source of this CME could be far-sided.

cmeAnalyses.note: Plane-of-sky measurement based only on running difference imagery from SOHO LASCO C3. While the CME is visible in SOHO LASCO C2, it is not well-defined.

note: CME first seen to the E in SOHO LASCO C2 starting around 2025-06-09T00:36Z. CME is also seen to the E in SOHO LASCO C3 and GOES CCOR-1 but not in STEREO A COR2. The source of this CME could be related to some extremely faint field line movement from beyond the E limb best seen in SDO AIA 193 beginning around 2025-06-08T23:00Z.

cmeAnalyses.note: Plane-of-sky measurement chosen due to lack of available triangulation and lack of visible source candidate.

note: This CME is visible to the northeast in SOHO LASCO C2/C3 and STEREO A COR2 imagery. This event is not seen in GOES CCOR-1 as it is obscured by the pylon. The source is likely related to an opening of field lines observed over the northeast limb in SDO AIA 171 and 193 imagery starting around 2025-06-09T08:30Z.

cmeAnalyses.note: Measurement based on the best fit between SOHO LASCO C2/C3 and STEREO A COR2 imagery.

note: This CME is visible to the northeast in SOHO LASCO C2/C3, GOES CCOR-1, and STEREO A COR2 imagery. The source is either far-sided or related to an eruption centered near N17E70 starting around 2025-06-09T10:50Z as seen in SDO AIA 131, 171, 193, 304 imagery.

cmeAnalyses.note: Measurement based on the best fit between SOHO LASCO C3 and STEREO A COR2 imagery.

note: This CME is visible to the northeast in SOHO LASCO C2/C3, GOES CCOR-1, and STEREO A COR2 imagery. The source is likely far-sided as there are no source signatures visible on the Earth-facing disk around the time of this event.

cmeAnalyses.note: Measurement based on the best fit between SOHO LASCO C3 and STEREO A COR2 imagery.

note: CME observed to the northeast in SOHO LASCO C2/C3, STEREO A COR2, and GOES CCOR-1. The source is likely a filament eruption on/just beyond the northeast limb starting around 2025-06-09T15:06Z, observed in SDO AIA 304 and GOES SUVI 304 as the filament ejecta and in SDO AIA 171/193 and GOES SUVI 284 as field line movement. This source is notably close to the CME start time in SOHO LASCO C2, however no other visible sources in SDO or GOES line up with this front observation.

cmeAnalyses.note: Triangulated measurement between later frames of SOHO LASCO C3 and STEREO A COR2 only, as the front fans out and widens, and deflects slightly northward, from its first visible frames in SOHO LASCO C2.

note: Thin CME less than 10 half-width to the NE observed in SOHO LASCO C2/C3, STEREO A COR, and GOES CCOR-1. The source is likely some field line movement observed on/just beyond the NE limb starting around 2025-06-09T18:18Z in SDO AIA 171.

cmeAnalyses.note: Triangulated measurement between SOHO LASCO C2/C3 and STEREO A COR2. This CME is notably less than 10 half width and deflects northward, making it difficult to track with the swpc_cat tool. High confidence in its high northern latitude.

note: Faint loop CME seen to the West in SOHO LASCO C2/C3, GOES CCOR-1, and STEREO A COR2. The source is a filament eruption beyond the West limb observed in SDO AIA 171/193/304 starting at 2025-06-09T20:04Z. This filament eruption can be seen in STEREO A EUVI 304 for a single frame at 2025-06-09T20:45Z, which shows the source location to be centered at S07W127.

cmeAnalyses.note: Best fit using several frames of SOHO LASCO C2 and a few frames of SOHO LASCO C3 and STEREO A COR2, as well as source location seen in available UV imagery.

note: CME observed to the northeast in SOHO LASCO C2/C3, GOES CCOR-1, and STEREO A COR2 for two frames before a data gap begins at 2025-06-09T21:38Z. The source is likely a filament eruption just on the northeast limb starting around 2025-06-09T20:33Z, observed in SDO AIA 304 and GOES SUVI 304 as the filament ejecta, and additionally in SDO AIA 171 as field line movement.

cmeAnalyses.note: Triangulated measurement between SOHO LASCO C2/C3, and STEREO A COR2 for two frames before the data gap begins at 2025-06-09T21:38Z. Measurement is at E90 and is not plane-of-sky.

note: Faint loop CME seen to the northeast in SOHO LASCO C2/C3, GOES CCOR-1, and STEREO A COR2. Source is a rising loop seen on or just beyond the NE limb at about N18 starting around 2025-06-09T22:54 in GOES SUVI 284. Field line movement can also been seen in SDO AIA 171/193. Analysis of this CME was affected by a data gap in SOHO LASCO C2/C3 between 2025-06-09T22:36Z to 2025-06-10T03:00Z and 2025-06-10T05:36Z to 2025-06-10T08:36Z, which backfilled later during the day, around approximately 2025-06-10T14:50Z.

cmeAnalyses.note: Best fit using several frames of SOHO LASCO C3 and a few frames of STEREO A COR2, as well as source location seen in available UV imagery.

note: Narrow flux rope CME seen to the Northeast in SOHO LASCO C2/C3, GOES CCOR-1, and STEREO A COR2. Source is a small eruption just beyond the NE limb as seen in SDO AIA 171/304, located at N22, starting at 2025-06-10T00:57Z. Analysis of this CME was partially affected by a data gap in SOHO LASCO C2/C3 from 2025-06-09T22:36Z to 2025-06-10T03:00Z.

cmeAnalyses.note: Measurement made using best triangulated fit between SOHO LASCO C3 and STEREO A COR2.

note: This CME is visible to the northeast in SOHO LASCO C2/C3, GOES CCOR-1, and STEREO A COR2 imagery. The source is likely related to an eruption seen near or just beyond the northeast limb starting around 2025-06-10T04:30Z as seen in SDO AIA 131, 171, 193, 304 imagery. A subsequent opening of field lines is visible over the northeast limb in SDO AIA 171 imagery around this time as well.

cmeAnalyses.note: Measurement based on the approximate source location and best fit between GOES CCOR-1 and STEREO A COR2 imagery.

note: This CME is visible to the northeast in SOHO LASCO C2/C3, GOES CCOR-1, and STEREO A COR2 imagery. The source is likely related to an eruption observed near the northeast limb starting around 2025-06-10T04:45Z as seen in SDO AIA 131, 171, 193, 304 imagery. A subsequent opening of field lines is visible over the northeast limb in SDO AIA 171 imagery around this time as well.

cmeAnalyses.note: Measurement based on the approximate source location and best fit between GOES CCOR-1 and STEREO A COR2 imagery.

note: This CME is visible to the northeast in SOHO LASCO C2/C3, GOES CCOR-1 and to the north in STEREO A COR2 imagery. The source may be related to faint field line movement visible over the northeast limb in GOES SUVI 284 imagery starting around 2025-06-10T04:30Z.

cmeAnalyses.note: Measurement based on the best fit between SOHO LASCO C2/C3 and STEREO A COR2 imagery. As the source is far-sided and a precise source location is unknown, the measured longitude may vary slightly.

note: This CME is visible to the northeast in SOHO LASCO C2/C3 and north in STEREO A COR2 imagery. This event is obscured by the pylon in GOES CCOR-1. The source may be related to very faint field line movement visible over the north/northeast limb in SDO AIA 171 and GOES SUVI 284 imagery starting around 2025-06-10T06:30Z.

cmeAnalyses.note: Measurement based on the best fit between SOHO LASCO C2 and STEREO A COR2 imagery. The measured longitude may vary slightly as the source is far-sided and a precise source location is therefore unknown.

note: This CME is visible to the northeast in SOHO LASCO C2/C3, GOES CCOR-1, and STEREO A COR2 imagery. The source is likely related to an eruption observed near the northeast limb starting around 2025-06-10T10:00Z as seen in SDO AIA 131, 171, 193, 304 imagery.

cmeAnalyses.note: Measurement based on the approximate source location and best fit between SOHO LASCO C2/C3 and STEREO A COR2 imagery.

note: CME observed to the northeast in SOHO LASCO C2/C3, GOES CCOR-1, and STEREO A COR2. The source is an unnumbered active region on the northeast limb, observed here as field line movement in SDO AIA 171 starting around 2025-06-10T14:33Z which traces down to around N18E90.

cmeAnalyses.note: Triangulated measurement with SOHO LASCO C3 and STEREO A COR2. CME appears slightly less wide in STEREO A COR2 imagery, LASCO C3 measured half-width is used here.

note: CME observed to the northeast in SOHO LASCO C2/C3, GOES CCOR-1, and STEREO A COR2. The source is an unnumbered active region on the northeast limb, observed here as field line movement in SDO AIA 171 starting around 2025-06-10T16:27Z which traces down to around N16E90.

cmeAnalyses.note: Triangulated measurement between SOHO LASCO C2/C3 and STEREO A COR2. CME appears to have deflected notably further north and west from the observed source near the limb (N16E90) via triangulation.

note: CME observed to the northeast in SOHO LASCO C2/C3, GOES CCOR-1, and faintly in a few frames of STEREO A COR2. The source is an unnumbered active region on the northeast limb, observed here as filament ejecta in SDO AIA 304 starting around 2025-06-10T18:42Z, originating from around N17E90 where it then more widely fans out. Also observed as field line movement in SDO AIA 171 at this time.

cmeAnalyses.note: Triangulated measurement between later frames of SOHO LASCO C3 and two available, low quality running difference images of STEREO A COR2. The CME deflects northward as it travels through LASCO C2 to C3 so later frames capture the final width and direction better. STEREO A COR2 imagery becomes sparse over this CME leading to lower quality running difference imagery that is usable.

note: This event is faint but visible to the north in SOHO LASCO C2/C3 imagery for a few frames before becoming too diffuse to observe. This event is blocked by the pylon in GOES CCOR-1 and too faint to observe in STEREO A COR2 imagery. The source is likely far-sided as there are no source signatures on the Earth-facing disk around the time of this event.

cmeAnalyses.note: A plane-of-sky measurement was made using a longitude of -90 degrees due to the far-sided and therefore uncertain source location.

note: This CME is visible to the northeast in SOHO LASCO C2/C3, STEREO A COR2, and GOES CCOR-1 imagery. The source is likely related to an eruption observed near the northeast limb starting around 2025-06-11T02:50Z as seen in SDO AIA 131, 171, 193, 304 imagery. A subsequent opening of field lines is visible over the northeast limb in SDO AIA 171 and GOES SUVI 284 at this time as well.

cmeAnalyses.note: Measurement based on the approximate source location and best fit between SOHO LASCO C2/C3 and STEREO A COR2 imagery.

note: This event is visible to the west in SOHO LASCO C2/C3 and GOES CCOR-1 imagery. The source is likely related to an eruption from Active Region 14107 (S15W43) starting around 2025-06-11T06:20Z as seen in SDO AIA 131, 171, 193, 304 imagery. A subsequent opening of field lines is visible over the western limb in SDO AIA 171 and GOES SUVI 284 imagery.

cmeAnalyses.note: Measured longitude based on the source location. A triangulated measurement was not available as this event is not visible in STEREO A COR2 imagery. The measured parameters may vary slightly as a result.

note: This CME is visible to the northeast in SOHO LASCO C2/C3, GOES CCOR-1, and STEREO A COR2 imagery. The source is likely associated with an eruption near Active Region 14113 and subsequent opening of field lines over the northeast limb starting around 2025-06-11T14:00Z as seen in SDO AIA 131, 171, and 193 imagery.

cmeAnalyses.note: Measurement based on the best fit between GOES CCOR-1 and STEREO A COR2 imagery.

note: This CME is visible to the E/NE in SOHO LASCO C2, C3, GOES CCOR-1, and STEREO A COR2 imagery. The source is unclear but may be associated with faint moving/opening field lines beyond the NE limb in GOES SUVI 284 starting around 2025-06-11T15:22Z.

cmeAnalyses.note: Parameters based on best fit using SOHO LASCO C3 and STEREO A COR2 imagery. This CME overlaps the CME first seen in SOHO LASCO C2 at 2025-06-11T14:36Z.

note: This CME is visible to the East in SOHO LASCO C2, C3, GOES CCOR-1, and STEREO A COR2 imagery. The source may be a filament eruption starting around 2025-06-11T18:27Z between S00E40 and S20E60 as seen in SDO/AIA 304 with brightening and dimming seen in SDO/AIA 193. There is a large coronal hole to the south of this eruption which may have contributed to deflection of the CME.

cmeAnalyses.note: Parameters are based on best fit using SOHO LASCO C3, STEREO A COR2, and GOES CCOR-1 imagery. The leading edge is slightly diffuse which may contribute to some uncertainty with these parameters.

note: CME seen to the NNE in STEREO A COR2 and NE in SOHO LASCO C2 and GOES CCOR-1. Source is very slow liftoff of several large loops of field lines from the NE limb, centered at about N35, seen starting as early as 2025-06-11T19:00Z in GOES SUVI 284. Analysis of this CME was affected by a data gap in SOHO LASCO C2/C3 which started at 2025-06-12T02:36Z and is scheduled to end at 2025-06-12T21:35Z. This CME overlaps with and was sourced from the same occasion of field line movement as CME: 2025-06-12T04:38Z.

cmeAnalyses.note: Triangulated measurement using several frames of GOES CCOR-1 and STEREO A COR2. About half of this CME is obstructed by the pylon in GOES CCOR-1. Analysis of this CME was affected by a data gap in SOHO LASCO C2/C3 which started at 2025-06-12T02:36Z and is scheduled to end at 2025-06-12T21:35Z.

note: This CME is visible to the west in SOHO LASCO C2, C3, GOES CCOR-1, and after a data gap in STEREO A COR2 imagery. The source is a filament eruption beyond the western limb as seen in SDO/AIA 304 and GOES SUVI 304 starting around 2025-06-11T20:45Z. Associated moving/opening field lines and post-eruptive arcades are visible in SDO/AIA 193, 171, 211 and GOES SUVI 284, 195. Brightening is also visible following a data gap in STEREO A EUVI at 2025-06-12T00:45Z.

cmeAnalyses.note: Preliminary measurement. Parameters based on best fit using SOHO LASCO C3, STEREO A COR2, and GOES CCOR-1 imagery.

note: Faint loop CME seen to the NE in STEREO A COR2 and GOES CCOR-1. Source is very slow liftoff of several large loops of field lines from the NE limb, centered at about N35, seen starting as early as 2025-06-11T19:00Z in GOES SUVI 284. Analysis of this CME was affected by a data gap in SOHO LASCO C2/C3 which started at 2025-06-12T02:36Z and is scheduled to end at 2025-06-12T21:35Z.

cmeAnalyses.note: Triangulated measurement using several frames of GOES CCOR-1 and STEREO A COR2. Analysis of this CME was affected by a data gap in SOHO LASCO C2/C3 which started at 2025-06-12T02:36Z and is scheduled to end at 2025-06-12T21:35Z.

note: Faint CME seen only to the north in STEREO A COR2 but covered by the data gap in SOHO and by the pylon in CCOR-1. Its source is likely the filament eruption on disk close to the northeast limb, with filamentary material seen lifting off of the northeast quadrant, close to the limb, centered at about N30E30, starting at 2025-06-12T05:19Z in SDO AIA 304, with the dimming seen in SDO AIA 193 and with ejecta and opening field lines both with northward deflection as seen in SDO AIA 171.

cmeAnalyses.note: An extremely uncertain one-coronagraph (STEREO A COR2) analysis based on the location of the possible source of this CME, the filament eruption. The CME front of this CME is only seen in a few early timestamps of STEREO A COR2 coronagraph, superimposed on the previous CME. The CME is not seen in other coronagraphs.

note: CME observed to the west in only STEREO A COR2 imagery. The CME may be too faint/directed away from the occulting disk to observe in GOES CCOR-1, and a large data gap in SOHO LASCO from 2025-06-12T02:45Z-T21:35Z is preventing real-time observation. The source appears to be far-sided, evidenced by lack of on-disk visibility and a single frame of filament ejecta on the west limb viewed from STEREO A EUVI 304 at 2025-06-12T10:15Z which may be the source.

cmeAnalyses.note: STEREO A plane-of-sky at W128.1, with current spacecraft longitude at W38.1. 3D analysis may become available if CME is visible in SOHO LASCO C2/C3 when the imagery downlinks.

note: Narrow faint CME to the southwest only seen in STEREO A COR2. The source could be a filament eruption close to the W limb seen starting in SDO AIA 171 after 2025-06-13T13:20Z, however this seems too early for this CME. The CME is not clearly seen in CCOR-1 and covered by gap in SOHO LASCO.

cmeAnalyses.note: A very approximate POS analysis based on STEREO A COR2 imagery.

note: CME seen to the NE in all three coronagraphs, with a fainter shock front and a brighter bulk. The CME appears narrower in STEREO A COR2 than in SOHO LASCO and GOES CCOR-1. Its source is the filament eruption centered around (N20E65) near Active Regioin 14115, as seen in SDO AIA 304/193 and GOES SUVI 304 after 2025-06-12T19:16Z.

cmeAnalyses.note: Analysis based on the likely source of this CME (filament eruption in/near AR 14115) and confirmed by the good fit with two coronagraphs (STEREO A COR2 and SOHO LASCO C3).

note: CME observed to the NE in SOHO LASCO C2/C3, GOES CCOR-1, and STEREO A COR2. The source is likely field line movement originating around N28E70, NE of AR 14115 (N21E66), observed in SDO AIA 171/193/304 and GOES SUVI 171/284/304 starting around 2025-06-13T00:24Z.

cmeAnalyses.note: Triangulated measurement between SOHO LASCO C2/C3 and STEREO A COR2.

note: Faint narrow CME seen to the southwest in SOHO LASCO and STEREO A COR2. Its source is a very narrow filament eruption approximately centered at (~S21W70), as seen in GOES SUVI and SDO AIA 304, and also seen as a narrow movement of field line on/near the southwest limb seen in GOES SUVI 284 after 2025-06-13T01:20Z.

cmeAnalyses.note: Approximate analysis based on the fit with two coronagraphs (SOHO LASCO and STEREO A COR2). The resulting latitude and longitude also loosely fit the likely source of the CME (filament eruption).

note: Wide and slow CME/Streamer blowout, with a flux rope seen in coronagraph and with the start time that can be even earlier (at ~02Z), seen to the northwest in all coronagraphs. No possible source has been found on disk.

cmeAnalyses.note: Very approximate analysis based on the fit with two coronagraphs (STEREO A COR2 and SOHO LASCO).

note: Faint narrow CME to the northeast in SOHO LASCO C2/C3, STEREO A COR2 and GOES CCOR-1, with a somewhat uncertain front seen superimposed on the outflow following the  2025-06-13T00:48Z CME. No source has been found for this event, but it could be Active Region 14115 (N21E64), which produced previous CMEs seen in the northeast.

cmeAnalyses.note: Approximate analysis based on the fit in two coronagraphs (SOHO LASCO and STEREO A COR2), which seems to confirm the suspicion that Active Region 14115 might be the source of this event.

note: Narrow faint CME with a fuzzy, difficult to discern, front north northeast in SOHO LASCO and northeast in STEREO A COR2. Its source could be the filament eruption northeast of Active Region 14111 centered at (N20E23), seen in SDO AIA 304/193 as an ejecta, dimming and high post-eruptive arcades seen starting at 2025-06-13T16:24Z.

cmeAnalyses.note: A very approximate analysis based on the fit of the fuzzy front in two coronagraphs (SOHO LASCO and STEREO A COR2) and on the source - the filament northeast of Active Region 14111.

note: Narrow faint CME with a fuzzy front seen to the west in STEREO A COR2, GOES CCOR-1 and fainter in SOHO LASCO C2. Its source is likely the narrow opening of field lines on/behind the west limb, seen in SDO AIA 193 at 2025-06-13T19:18Z.

cmeAnalyses.note: Approximate analysis based on the fit of the narrow front in two coronagraphs (SOHO LASCO and STEREO A COR2), confirming the source as likely being behind the west limb.

note: This CME is visible to the W/SW in SOHO LASCO C2, C3, GOES CCOR-1, and STEREO A COR2 imagery. The source is a filament eruption starting around 2025-06-14T02:48Z from the area of Active Region 14109 (S17W46) as seen in SDO/AIA 304 and GOES SUVI 304 with moving field lines visible along the limb in GOES SUVI 284. Some deflection may be possible due to the coronal hole to the East of the source location.

cmeAnalyses.note: Parameters based on best fit using SOHO LASCO C2, C3, GOES CCOR-1, and STEREO A COR2 imagery. The CME becomes too faint/diffuse to track far out into the field of view.

note: CME observed to the north in SOHO LASCO C2/C3 and STEREO A COR2. CME blocked by the pylon in GOES:CCOR-1. The potential source is a C4.9 flare peaking at 2025-06-14T15:02Z and eruption from Active Region 14114 (approximately N18E30). Dimming seen to the northwest of this active region following the flare around 2025-06-14T15:20Z best seen in SDO AIA 193/211.

cmeAnalyses.note: Measurement based on best fit between SOHO LASCO C2/C3 and STEREO A COR2 imagery in SWPC_CAT as well as potential source location.

note: CME faintly visible to the NW in GOES CCOR-1 and the NEE in STEREO A COR2 after a data gap from 2025-06-14T20:09Z to 2025-06-15T00:38Z. Not visible in SOHO LASCO in real-time due to a data gap, but after the backfill of LASCO, first visible in SOHO LASCO C2 at 22:12Z. The likely source is an eruption with brightening and an ejecta of material starting at 2025-06-14T21:12Z from AR 14111 (N14W00) which strongly deflects to the northwest as seen in GOES SUVI 304 imagery.

cmeAnalyses.note: Preliminary measurement using GOES CCOR-1 imagery in SWPC_CAT. The latitude and longitude are based on the best fit in imagery and estimated due to the eruption's deflection to the northwest.

note: A relatively narrow CME with irregular shape (possibly encompassing two consecutive overlapping CMEs). Its source is possibly the C7.6 flare and eruption in Active Region 14114 (N17E24) peaking at 2025-06-15T03:48Z and the associated eruption seen starting at 2025-06-15T03:34Z in SDO AIA 304/193, EUVI A 195 and GOES SUVI 284 as ejecta and deep dimming.

cmeAnalyses.note: Approximate analysis encompassing this whole event (which possibly consists of two consecutive CMEs) - encompassing its eastern earlier front and the later, more western (possibly slower) front. Analysis is heavily based on the longitude of the likely source (flare and eruption near Active Region 14114) and on the fits with two coronagraphs (SOHO LASCO and STEREO A COR2). The fit indicates there was a very significant deflection of the CME northward.

note: Faint CME preceding 2025-06-15T08:12Z CME with the front seen mostly in SOHO LASCO C2 (but fading towards the field of view of C2) and very faintly seen in C3 and GOES CCOR-1 and barely possible to discern in a couple early timestamps of STEREO A COR2 (no clear front there). Its source is likely a very minor eruption seen in Active Region 4105 (S15W74) around 2025-06-15T04:30Z which is mainly seen in SDO AIA and GOES SUVI 304 not as ejecta but as brightening; there is also a relatively faint but distinct wide opening of field lines/restructuring in corona that might be close to/on/behind the west limb in GOES SUVI 284 at 2025-06-15T04:42Z, and which may be associated with activity from Active Region 4105 (but this is uncertain).

cmeAnalyses.note: Very approximate analysis based on the fitting of the front that is super faint in STEREO A COR2 but is clear in early timestamps of SOHO LASCO C2 with two coronagraphs. The resulting longitude and latitude correspond well to the location of the Active Region 4105, which is a likely source.

note: Minor, fast eruption seen to the northwest in SOHO C2 but blocked by the pylon in SOHO C3. Seen to the north-northeast in STEREO A COR2. Not clearly visible in GOES CCOR-1. Associated with a minor jet/spray eruption from near AR4113 around N10W00 best seen in GOES SUVI 284 around 2025-06-15T06:35Z.

cmeAnalyses.note: Leading edge plane of sky measurement using only SOHO C2 as the CME is not well seen in STEREO A COR2.

note: Bright asymmetrical CME seen to the west in all three coronagraphs. Its source is the M2.2 flare from AR 4105 (S15W70) peaking 2025-06-15T07:56Z and the associated eruption with faint ejecta seen going westward in GOES SUVI 304, post-eruptive arcades best seen in SDO AIA 193/304 and EUVI A 195, and a relatively small area of dimming centered around (S11W65) seen in SDO AIA 193 and even clearer in EUVI A 195.

cmeAnalyses.note: Analysis based on the fit with two coronagraphs (SOHO LASCO and STEREO A COR2) and loosely confirmed by the source location of the flare, Active Region 4105. It looks like there is some deflection northeastwards.

note: A narrowish CME following and overlapping with the 2025-06-15T08:12Z CME with the distinct front best seen in STEREO A COR2 but also discernible in SOHO LASCO C2. Its source might be an eruption to the northwest of Active Region 14105 at the time of/directly following the M2.2 flare from this active region, which was also associated with a minor dimming a bit to the east of the active region. This more western dimming is best seen in EUVI A 193 after the flare; it is significant in size but faint.

cmeAnalyses.note: Approximate analysis based on the fit of the front in two coronagraphs (SOHO LASCO and STEREO A COR2) and confirmed by a faint dimming to the east of the flaring active region 14105 seen mostly in EUVI A 195.

note: Extremely faint loop CME seen to the W in SOHO LASCO C2 for a few frames before becoming diffuse. This CME is not visible in SOHO LASCO C3, STEREO A COR2, or GOES CCOR-1 due to the faintness of the leading edge. Source is a series of gradually-rising loops of field lines seen ejected from on or near the West limb in GOES SUVI 284 starting at 2025-06-15T17:08Z. A continuing outflow of other rising loops from this same location can be seen continuously and slowly lifting off through at least 2025-06-15T20:00Z. A minor brightening and eruption from S12W90, possibly the northern portion of AR 14105 (S15W80, at the time) can be seen at 2025-06-15T18:03Z in SDO AIA 171/193 as well as associated field line opening. It is very likely that this is the source for one of the subsequent outflows. Brightening and a ribbon of material can be seen in GOES SUVI 304, as well as a rising loop, but it appears that the ribbon may not have fully ejected and fell back to the surface.

cmeAnalyses.note: Measurement using only SOHO LASCO C2 frames since the leading edge becomes diffuse before reaching the edge of the C2 field of view. Measurement based on best fit in SOHO LASCO C2 and the location of the source at W90 as identified in available UV imagery.

note: Another somewhat asymmetric CME from Active Region 14114 - this one is associated with the M8.4 flare from this Active Region (N18E15) peaking at 2025-06-15T18:07Z, and with eruption seen as significant dimming somewhat to the northwest of the active region, with post-eruptive arcades and EUV wave also seen in SDO AIA 193/304 and in EUVI A 195. The CME likely deflected northwards.

cmeAnalyses.note: Best fit measurement using multiple frames of SOHO LASCO C3 and STEREO A COR2 imagery, as well as the location of the on-disk source and likely deflection observed in available UV imagery.
Preliminary analysis all SOHO LASCO C2 imagery and with a couple early images of C3 and STEREO A COR2.

note: Bright CME visible to the west in SOHO LASCO C2, C3, GOES CCOR-1, and STEREO A COR2. The source is a C6.5 flare from AR 14109 (S16W77) as seen in SDO/AIA 131. The flare is associated with a filament eruption seen in SDO/AIA 304, GOES SUVI 304, and STEREO A EUVI 304 starting around 2025-06-16T01:53Z. Moving/opening field lines are also visible beyond the western limb in GOES SUVI 284 starting around 2025-06-16T01:58Z.

cmeAnalyses.note: Parameters based on best fit using SOHO LASCO C3, GOES CCOR-1, and STEREO A COR2 imagery.

note: Bright CME visible to the NW in STEREO A COR2 and GOES CCOR-1 imagery. There is currently a data gap in SOHO LASCO C2/C3 imagery for this event. The source of the CME is a filament on/beyond the NW limb in SDO/AIA 304, GOES SUVI 304, and STEREO A EUVI 304 starting around 2025-06-16T04:15Z. Moving/opening field lines are visible beyond the NW limb in SDO/AIA 171 and 193, as well as in GOES SUVI 284.

cmeAnalyses.note: Parameters based on best fit using STEREO A COR2 and GOES CCOR-1 imagery. There was no SOHO LASCO imagery available during this analysis.

note: This CME is visible to the N/NE in SOHO LASCO C2, C3, GOES CCOR-1 (partially obstructed by the control arm), STEREO A COR2 imagery. The source is an M6.3 flare from Active Region 14114 (N17E07) which is visible in SDO/AIA 131, 193, 171, 211, and 304 as well as GOES SUVI wavelengths. Associated dimming, brightening, and small EUV wave visible to the north of the Active Region starting around 2025-06-16T09:45Z.

cmeAnalyses.note: Parameters based on best fit using SOHO LASCO C3 and STEREO A COR2 imagery. There is a portion of the irregularly shaped front that was excluded from this fit.

note: Narrow fast CME to the northeast(it looks a bit like a protruding nose of the more complex, likely 2-CME, conglomerate) the source of which is a possible 2-filament eruption east of Active Region 14115: a complex, two-pronged filament eruption with bright post-eruptive arcades centered ~(N21E20) in SDO AIA 304 which is likely associated with the C5.5 flare centered around N21E22 and peaking at 2025-06-17T00:38Z. There is also a more eastern filament that is possibly erupting at the same time.

A partial northeastern halo overlapping with the earlier 2025-06-17T00:36Z CME which is somewhat narrower. Its source is likely the more western part of the complex eruption  associated with the C5.5 flare from N21E22 peaking at 2025-06-17T00:38Z from east of AR 4115.
Faint narrow CME with a somewhat fuzzy front. Its source is a pretty mid-size eruption off the southeast limb (at the lat of -16 degrees) seen in SDO AIA 304 at 2024-06-17T01:57Z.

cmeAnalyses.note: Approximate analysis based on the fit of the front of this CME in two coronagraphs (SOHO LASCO and STEREO A COR2). The source is on the limb or closely behind it so the longitude could be somewhat different.

note: CME first seen to the SE in SOHO LASCO C2 starting at 2025-06-17T04:48Z. Also seen to the SE in SOHO LASCO C3, STEREO A COR2, and GOES CCOR-1. This jet-like CME is seen in running difference imagery before it is visible in white light imagery. The source of this CME is likely a minor filament eruption near the SE limb best seen in AIA 304 starting around 2025-06-17T03:24Z.

cmeAnalyses.note: Measurement based on triangulation between SOHO LASCO C2/C3 and STEREO A COR2 as well as visible source.

note: Narrow fast CME to the NE observed in SOHO LASCO C2/C3, STEREO A COR2, and GOES CCOR-1 coronagraphs. Source could be a narrow opening of field lines behind the NE limb at 2025-06-17T07:51 in SDO AIA 171.

cmeAnalyses.note: Triangulated with SOHO LASCO C2/C3, STEREO A COR2, and GOES CCOR-1.

note: CME first seen to the SE in SOHO LASCO C2 starting at 2025-06-17T09:12Z. CME is also seen to the SE in SOHO LASCO C3, STEREO A COR2, and GOES CCOR-1. The source of this CME is likely related to some eruptive activity near the SE limb best seen in SDO AIA 304 beginning around 2025-06-17T08:00Z and continuing for a couple of hours. This eruptive activity also includes a C5.5 flare peaking at 2025-06-17T08:13Z.

cmeAnalyses.note: Measurement based on triangulation between SOHO LASCO C2/C3 and STEREO A COR2 as well as visible source location.

note: Faint CME observed to the west best in SOHO LASCO C2 and STEREO A COR2, due to faintness it is difficult to see in LASCO C3 and GOES CCOR-1. The source of this CME could be related to a filament eruption near the SW limb best seen in SDO AIA 304 beginning around 2025-06-17T09:56Z. There is also some activity from beyond the W limb from what is likely former AR 14109 that could be related.

cmeAnalyses.note: Triangulated measurement between early frames SOHO LASCO C2 and STEREO A COR2 before it comes too faint to resolve well. Longitude could vary W90-W110 based on fitting attempts, uncertainty due to faint front.

note: CME first seen to the W in SOHO LASCO C2 starting at 2025-06-17T15:00Z. Also seen to the W in SOHO LASCO C3, STEREO A COR2, and GOES CCOR-1. There is some northward deflection within the FOV of SOHO LASCO C2. The source of the CME is likely some long duration eruptive activity from beyond the W limb starting around 2025-06-17T13:00Z seen across SDO AIA wavelengths.

cmeAnalyses.note: Measurement based on triangulation between SOHO LASCO C2 and STEREO A COR2 as well as visible source location.

note: Wispy fan-shaped CME observed to the NE in SOHO LASCO C2/C3 only. Source may be some weak, faint field line movement observed over the NE limb in SDO AIA 171 beginning around 2025-06-17T14:12Z.

cmeAnalyses.note: Plane-of-sky measurement with only SOHO LASCO C2/C3 as this CME is not observed well, or at all, in STEREO A COR2 or GOES CCOR-1, and there is uncertainty in the source location observed in SDO AIA 171. It may be, and is more likely, far-sided.

note: CME observed to the SE in SOHO LASCO C2/C3, STEREO A COR2, and GOES CCOR-1. There is no distinct source observed for this CME aside from continuous acitivity from the SE limb around this time, best observed in SDO AIA 171. This SE limb activity has been responsible for numerous other thin half width CME fronts around this timeframe.

cmeAnalyses.note: Triangulated measurement between SOHO LASCO C2/C3 and STEREO A COR2.

note: Wide CME observed to the W in SOHO LASCO C2/C3, STEREO A COR2, and GOES CCOR-1. The source is a far-sided filament eruption likely from old AR 4109, observed as filament ejecta in SDO AIA 304 beginning around 2025-06-17T22:51Z and field line movement in SDO AIA 171/193.

cmeAnalyses.note: Measurement made using best fit between SOHO LASCO C2/C3 and STEREO A COR2 imagery, as well as location of source seen in available UV imagery. Leading edge becomes diffuse abut halfway through the STEREO A COR2 field of view.

PRELIMINARY measurement. Triangulation between SOHO LASCO C2 and STEREO A COR2. This CME front is very rough and dimpled, so this measurement tracks the leading edge movement with the width encompasing the entire bright bulk material.

note: Bright, irregularly shaped CME seen to the W in SOHO LASCO C2/C3, GOES CCOR-1, and STEREO A COR2 imagery. Source is widely opening field lines and ejecta seen just beyond the SW limb first seen starting as early as 2025-06-18T04:15Z in SDO AIA 304/171/193/131 and GOES SUVI 284/304. This eruption and post-eruptive arcades can be seen in STEREO A EUVI 195/304 imagery, and is located at former Active Region 14105 (S15W120).

cmeAnalyses.note: Best fit measurement using several frames of SOHO LASCO C3 and STEREO A COR2, as well as location of source seen in available UV imagery.

note: CME visible to the NW in STEREO A COR2 and GOES CCOR-1. Not visible in real-time due to a data gap in SOHO LASCO C2/C3 starting at 2025-06-18T14:42Z. The potential source is seen beyond the west limb in GOES SUVI 284 starting at 2025-06-18T16:18Z as opening field lines. Brightening can also be seen on the west limb as seen in STEREO A EUV imagery at 2025-06-18T17:05Z.

cmeAnalyses.note: Measurement based on the best fit between GOES CCOR-1 and STEREO A COR2 in SWPC_CAT as well as potential source location.

note: This CME is visible to the SW in STEREO A COR2 and very faintly in SOHO LASCO C2. There is no clear source for this CME.

cmeAnalyses.note: Parameters are based on best fit using SOHO LASCO C2 and STEREO A COR2 imagery.

note: Narrow CME visible to the NW in SOHO LASCO C2/C3, STEREO A COR2, and GOES CCOR-1. The potential source can be seen as opening field lines beyond the west limb in GOES SUVI 284 starting at 2025-06-18T23:34Z. The eruption is not clearly visible in STEREO A EUV imagery.

cmeAnalyses.note: Updated measurement using additional later frames in all coronagraphs. With the backfill of SOHO imagery, the updated start time of this CME could be 2025-06-18T23:36Z as seen in SOHO LASCO C2.

Measurement based on best fit between coronagraphs in SWPC_CAT as well as potential source location. This measurement primarily uses SOHO LASCO C2 and early frames of GOES CCOR-1, STEREO A COR2, and SOHO LASCO C3 imagery.

note: Wide CME visible to the W/SW in SOHO LASCO C2, C3, GOES CCOR-1, and STEREO A COR2 imagery. The source appears to be a filament eruption beyond the W/SW limb in STEREO A EUVI 304 imagery starting around 2025-06-19T02:00Z. STEREO A COR2 imagery is in campaign mode for this event.

cmeAnalyses.note: Parameters based on best fit of the BULK of the CME using SOHO LASCO C2/C3, GOES CCOR-1, and STEREO A COR2 imagery.

Best fit measurement of wider, but fainter features using several frames of SOHO LASCO C3, GOES CCOR-1, and one frame of STEREO A COR2. Analysis of this CME was affected by a campaign in STEREO A COR2.

note: Faint outflow-like CME seen the northwest better in STEREO A COR2/SOHO C2 running difference imagery made up of a handful of small fronts/ejecta measured as one CME. No clear source on the Earth-facing disk was found for this CME, suggesting it is associated with far-sided eruptive activity.

cmeAnalyses.note: Leading edge measurement of the CME taken as a whole using STEREO A/SOHO for triangulation.

note: Narrow loop CME visible to the NW in SOHO LASCO C2/C3, GOES CCOR-1, and STEREO A COR2. Source is an eruption from beyond the W limb, seen as opening field lines and ejecta in GOES SUVI 284 starting at 2025-06-19T10:34Z. Field line movement can also be seen in STEREO A EUVI 193 around this time, on the W limb, which equates to W129 as seen from SDO.

cmeAnalyses.note: Best fit measurement using SOHO LASCO C2/C3, GOES CCOR-1, and STEREO A COR2. Analysis of this CME was affected by a campaign in STEREO A COR2.

note: CME observed to the southeast in SOHO LASCO C2/C3, STEREO A COR2, and GOES CCOR-1. Partially overlaps with later CME 2025-06-19T17:12Z. The source is best observed as opening field lines seen beyond the southeast limb in GOES SUVI 284 at 2025-06-19T14:32Z. Opening field lines are also seen beyond the SE limb in SDO AIA 171 starting at 2025-06-19T14:30Z.

cmeAnalyses.note: Best fit measurement using several frames of GOES CCOR-1 and a few frames of SOHO LASCO C3 and STEREO A COR2.

note: CME observed to the southeast in SOHO LASCO C2/C3, STEREO A COR2, and GOES CCOR-1. Partially overlaps with prior CME 2025-06-19T15:36Z. The source is best observed as opening field lines seen beyond the southeast limb in GOES SUVI 284 at 2025-06-19T16:34Z.

cmeAnalyses.note: Measurement using best fit between SOHO LASCO C3, GOES CCOR-1, and STEREO A COR2.

note: Narrow CME first seen to the SW in SOHO LASCO C2 starting at 2025-06-19T22:24Z. Also seen to the SW in SOHO LASCO C3 and GOES CCOR-1. Seen to the S in STEREO A COR2. The source of this CME is likely an eruption from AR 14116 (S12W41) starting around 2025-06-19T21:12Z with an area of dimming to the S best seen in SDO AIA 171 and SDO AIA 193.

cmeAnalyses.note: Measurement based on triangulation between SOHO LASCO C3 and STEREO A COR2 as well as visible source location.

note: Faint, thin CME observed to the north in SOHO LASCO C2/C3, STEREO A COR2, and GOES CCOR-1. The source is one of two close proximity eruptions in the northwest disk. A dimming and field line movement (N30W28) just north of AR 14115 starting around 2025-06-20T22:51Z in SDO AIA 193, and a double peaked X1.9 and M4.6 from AR 14114 (N19W38) starting at 2025-06-19T23:37Z in SDO AIA 131, both serve as possible candidates for this deflected high-latitude CME.

cmeAnalyses.note: Triangulated measurement between SOHO LASCO C3 and STEREO A COR2.

note: CME first seen to the NW in SOHO LASCO C2 starting at 2025-06-20T00:12Z. Also seen to the NW in SOHO LASCO C3, STEREO A COR2, and GOES CCOR-1. The source of this CME is uncertain and could be related to far-sided activity.

cmeAnalyses.note: Measurement based on low confidence triangulation between SOHO LASCO C2 and STEREO A COR2.

note: CME first seen to the SE in SOHO LASCO C2 starting at 2025-06-20T02:24Z. Also seen to the SE in SOHO LASCO C3, STEREO A COR2, and GOES CCOR-1. The source of this CME is uncertain but is likely on or beyond the limb.

cmeAnalyses.note: Measurement based triangulation between SOHO LASCO C2/C3 and STEREO A COR2.

note: Irregularly shaped CME first seen to the W in SOHO LASCO C2 starting around 2025-06-20T05:12Z. CME is also seen to the W in SOHO LASCO C3, GOES CCOR-1, and possibly very faintly in STEREO A COR2. There are a succession of fronts following this eruption. The associated measurement corresponds to the leading front. The source of this CME is a large filament eruption best seen in SDO AIA 304 beginning around 2025-06-20T02:20Z. The footpoints of the filament are located at approximately AR 14111 (N16W68) and AR 14116 (S10W47).

cmeAnalyses.note: High uncertainty single spacecraft measurement based on imagery from SOHO LASCO C3 and visible source location. Two frames from STEREO A COR2 aided with fit parameters, but the imagery quality was too grainy to be included in the measurement.

note: Faint CME observed to the NE in SOHO LASCO C2/C3, STEREO A COR2, and GOES CCOR-1. The source is likely an eruption of dimming and a short-lived post eruptive arcade centered around N10E45 starting around 2025-06-20T06:51Z.

cmeAnalyses.note: Triangulated measurement between SOHO LASCO C2/C3 and STEREO A COR2, front is notably faint and difficult to track.

note: CME first seen to the NW in SOHO LASCO C2 starting at 2025-06-20T15:36Z. Also seen to the NW in GOES CCOR-1. CME is blocked by the pylon in SOHO LASCO C3, and the data quality in STEREO A COR2 is too poor to distinguish the CME. The source of this CME is likely a small eruption just to the SW of AR 14114 at around N15W52 best seen in SDO AIA 304 beginning around 2025-06-20T15:09Z. The ejecta appears to be significantly deflected toward the NW.

cmeAnalyses.note: Single spacecraft measurement based on visible deflection in source signature.

note: CME first seen to the SE in GOES CCOR-1 starting at 2025-06-20T18:15Z. Also seen to the SE in SOHO LASCO C2/C3 and STEREO A COR2. The source of this CME is most likely associated with an M1.0 flare from AR 14118 peaking at 2025-06-20T17:40Z and an accompanying eruption. The flare and eruption are best seen in SDO AIA 131 and SDO AIA 304. Some dimming can also be seen to the SE of AR 14118 following the eruption. There is some eastern deflection evidenced by triangulated measurement and visible source signature.

cmeAnalyses.note: Measurement based on triangulation between SOHO LASCO C2/C3 and STEREO A COR2.

note: A very faint narrow jet seen to the west in STEREO A COR2 coronagraph only and not seen in SOHO or CCOR-1. No clear source was found for this CME.

cmeAnalyses.note: Since this CME is only seen in STEREO A COR2 imagery and no source has been found in EUV imagery it is only possible to make a plane-of-sky assessment of it.

note: High latitude CME seen to the north in SOHO LASCO and GOES CCOR-1 coronagraphs and to the northwest in STEREO A COR2. No clear source was found in EUVI imagery, so the event is likely far-sided.

cmeAnalyses.note: Very approximate analysis based solely on the fit with three coronagraphs (SOHO LASCO, STEREO A COR2 and GOES CCOR-1), as there is no clear source on disk.

note: Bright CME first seen in the NW by SOHO LASCO C2 beginning at 2025-06-22T14:00Z, as well as by STEREO A COR2 and GOES CCOR-1 in later frames. This event is obscured by the pylon in SOHO LASCO C3. The source of this event is an eruption centered at approx. N25W55 exhibiting Northern deflection as seen in SDO AIA 193. Field line opening and post eruptive arcades are also visible in SDO AIA 94, 171, 211 and GOES SUVI 284.

cmeAnalyses.note: Measurement based on approximate source location and best fit in SOHO LASCO C2. STEREO A COR2 and GOES CCOR-1.

note: Narrow jet seen to the west in all three coronagraphs. The source of this CME could be a C1.5 from near the west limb peaking at 2025-06-22T17:41Z.

cmeAnalyses.note: Approximate analysis based on the fit of this narrow jet with three coronagraphs. There is no clear source for this CME in EUV imagery to confirm these parameters.

note: Faint, jet-like CME first seen to the SW in SOHO LASCO C2 beginning at 2025-06-23T01:25Z, as well as by SOHO LASCO C3, STEREO A COR2, and GOES CCOR-1 in later frames. The source of this event is minor field line movement seen along the SW limb near AR 14116 (S10W82) in SDO AIA 193 and GOES SUVI 284.

cmeAnalyses.note: Measurement based on approximate source location and best fit in SOHO LASCO C3, GOES CCOR-1 and STEREO A COR2. The front of this event was too diffuse to reliably track in SOHO LASCO C2.

note: Faint jet-like CME visible to the West in SOHO LASCO C2/C3, GOES CCOR-1, and STEREO A COR2 imagery. The source of this CME may be a filament eruption visible along the W/NW limb in SDO/AIA 304 and GOES SUVI 304 starting around 2025-06-23T08:48Z.

cmeAnalyses.note: Parameters are based on best fit between GOES CCOR-1 and STEREO A COR2 imagery. Real-time SOHO imagery only had a few frames available which are not used in this fit.

note: Faint, narrow CME first seen in the West by SOHO LASCO C2 beginning at 2025-06-24T05:36Z, as well as by SOHO LASCO C3 and STEREO A COR2 in later frames. The source of this event is field line movement seen along the Western limb in SDO AIA 171 and 193. This CME is quickly overtaken by the following CME, CME: 2025-06-24T07:23Z.

cmeAnalyses.note: Measurement based on approximate source location and best fit between SOHO LASCO C3 and STEREO A COR2.

note: CME observed to the W in SOHO LASCO C2/C3, STEREO A COR2, and GOES CCOR-1. The source appears to be former active regions 14113/14114, as southward deflected field line movement over the W limb in SDO AIA 171/193 starting around 2025-06-24T07:03Z is complemented by a brightening around the area of former active regions 14113/14114 in STEREO A EUVI 304 at 2025-06-24T07:15Z.

cmeAnalyses.note: Triangulated measurement between SOHO LASCO C2/C3 and STEREO A COR2.

note: CME observed to the W in SOHO LASCO C2/C3, STEREO A COR2, and GOES CCOR-1. The source appears to be former active regions 14113/14114, as southward deflected field line movement over the W limb in SDO AIA 171/193 starting around 2025-06-24T08:42Z is complemented by a brightening around the area of former active regions 14113/14114 in STEREO A EUVI 304 at 2025-06-24T08:45Z.

cmeAnalyses.note: Triangulated measurement between SOHO LASCO C2/C3 and STEREO A COR2.

note: CME first seen in the East by STEREO A COR2 beginning at 2025-06-24T10:38Z, as well as by SOHO LASCO C2 and C3 in later frames. This event is  not clearly visible in GOES CCOR-1. The source of this event appears to be field line movement seen near AR 14121 (S15E25) showing Eastern deflection in SDO AIA 171.

cmeAnalyses.note: Measurement based on approximate source location and best fit between SOHO LASCO C2/C3 and STEREO A COR2.
Plane-of-sky measurement due to lack of clear source location and only STEREO A COR2 imagery available for this measurement.

note: CME observed to the W in SOHO LASCO C2/C3, STEREO A COR2, and GOES CCOR-1. The source appears to be former active regions 14113/14114, as southward deflected field line movement over the W limb in SDO AIA 171/193 starting around 2025-06-24T11:00Z.

cmeAnalyses.note: Triangulation between GOES CCOR-1 and STEREO A COR2.

note: CME observed to the W in SOHO LASCO C2/C3, STEREO A COR2, and GOES CCOR-1. The source appears to be former active regions 14113/14114, as southward deflected field line movement over the W limb in SDO AIA 171/193 starting around 2025-06-24T13:21Z is complemented by a brightening around the area of former active regions 14113/14114 in STEREO A EUVI 304 at 2025-06-24T13:15Z.

cmeAnalyses.note: Triangulation between GOES CCOR-1 and STEREO A COR2.

note: Faint CME first seen in the SE by STEREO A COR2 beginning at 2025-06-24T16:09Z, as well as by SOHO LASCO C2/C3 and GOES CCOR-1 in later frames. The source of this event is a minor eruption from the vicinity of Active Region 14117 (S15W05) exhibiting a Southeastern deflection as seen in SDO AIA 94, 171 and 193. This deflection is likely due to a large negative polarity coronal hole situated just Northwest of this eruption, causing a Southeastern deflection away from central meridian.

cmeAnalyses.note: Measurement based on approximate source location and best fit in SOHO LASCO C2/C3, STEREO A COR2 and GOES CCOR-1.

note: Narrow CME seen to the west in SOHO LASCO C2/C3, GOES CCOR-1, and STEREO A COR2. Source is uncertain, but possibly this small filament seen disappearing in STEREO A EUVI 304 imagery at about 2025-06-24T17:45Z, located at about N00W110. Faint field line movement is also visible beyond the STEREO A EUVI western limb around this time, so the source may be an eruption further beyond the limb.

cmeAnalyses.note: Measurement using best fit between SOHO LASCO C2/C3, GOES CCOR-1, and STEREO A COR2.

note: Narrow CME seen to the west in SOHO LASCO C2/C3, GOES CCOR-1, and STEREO A COR2. Source is uncertain. Faint field line movement is also visible beyond the STEREO A EUVI western limb around 2025-06-24T21:45Z, so the source may be an eruption well beyond the western limb.

cmeAnalyses.note: Best fit measurement using STEREO A COR2 and GOES CCOR-1.

note: CME first seen to the W in SOHO LASCO C2 starting at 2025-06-24T23:48Z. Also seen to the W in SOHO LASCO C3, STEREO A COR2, and GOES CCOR-1. There appears to be some slight northern deflection into the FOV of SOHO LASCO C3. The source of this CME is most likely some minor, almost continuous field line fluctuations from beyond the W limb best seen in SDO AIA 193.

cmeAnalyses.note: Measurement based on triangulation between SOHO LASCO C2/C3 and STEREO A COR2.

note: Very narrow, faint CME first seen to the E in SOHO LASCO C2 starting at 2025-06-25T02:24Z. This CME is much easier to see in running difference imagery and is not seen in STEREO A COR2. There is not a clearly definitely source candidate.

cmeAnalyses.note: Plane-of-sky measurement due to lack of available triangulation.

note: An extremely faint narrow CME/jet, the front of which is seen in difference imagery of SOHO LASCO C2 and STEREO A COR2 in a couple of timestamps (after which it dissipates) and not seen in SOHO LASCO C3. It is likely well out of ecliptic. No clear source was found, however there is possibly a very minor opening/movement of field lines to the NW in AIA 171/193 and GOES SUVI 284 around that time, but the source is unclear.

cmeAnalyses.note: An extremely approximate analysis based on the fit of a very faint, indistinct front in very few timestamps of two coronagraphs (C2 and STEREO A COR2).

note: CME first seen to the E in SOHO LASCO C2 starting at 2025-06-25T04:24Z. 2025-06-25T04:36Z start time chosen for distinction from previous CME. Also seen to the E in SOHO LASCO C3, GOES CCOR-1, and for a couple of frames in STEREO A COR2. The source of this CME is likely far-sided. There is some very faint field line movement from beyond the E limb best seen in SDO AIA 193 around 2025-06-25T02:30Z that could be the source of this CME.

cmeAnalyses.note: Measurement based on triangulation between SOHO LASCO C2/C3 and STEREO A COR2. This is a lower confidence measurement due to limited usable imagery.

note: CME first seen to the W in SOHO LASCO C2 starting at 2025-06-25T06:36Z. Also seen to the W in SOHO LASCO C3, STEREO A COR2, and GOES CCOR-1. There is some minor northward deflection into the FOV of SOHO LASCO C3. This CME will likely combine with the earlier, slower CME: 2025-05-24T23:48Z. The source of this CME is most likely from beyond the W limb. There is some minor field line movement visible over the W limb in SDO AIA 193 starting around 2025-05-25T06:00Z

cmeAnalyses.note: Measurement based on triangulation between SOHO LASCO C2/C3 and STEREO A COR2.

note: Faint CME seen to the NNW in STEREO A COR2 and GOES CCOR-1, but fully covered by a data gap in SOHO. No clear source was found for this event.

cmeAnalyses.note: Approximate analysis based on the fit of the front in two coronagraphs (GOES CCOR-1 and STEREO A COR2)

note: A relatively wide CME with a several closely following and rather messy consecutive fronts, first seen in GOES CCOR-1 around 2025-06-25T19:45Z, with its start obscured by gaps in STEREO A and SOHO. The start of this CME is likely earlier. The source is likely the opening of field lines on the NW limb seen in GOES SUVI 284 starting around 2025-06-25T15:20Z, possibly connected with the eruption of the long filament in the NW sector around that time as seen in SDO AIA 304.

cmeAnalyses.note: Preliminary analysis based on the fit of the front in three coronagraphs.

Very approximate analysis of one of the more pronounced fronts of this event based on the fit with three coronagraphs, and confirmed by the possible source - eruption of the filament in the NW quadrant. Longitude could vary by 10 degrees.

note: Narrow CME seen to the south in SOHO LASCO C2/C3 and GOES CCOR-1. Seen to the southeast in STEREO A COR2. Source is uncertain. Source may possibly be some very subtle opening field lines seen from Active Region 14121 (S12E01) around 2025-06-25T20:19Z. Some very small post-eruptive arcades are seen at AR 14121 at 2025-06-25T19:27Z seen in SDO AIA 193, with some very gradual field line reconfiguration in a small area just to the southwest of AR 14121 afterwards, but this is a very minor signature.

cmeAnalyses.note: Best fit measurement triangulating between SOHO LASCO C2/C3, STEREO A COR2, and GOES CCOR-1.

note: Flux rope CME visible to the NW in SOHO LASCO C2/C3, STEREO A COR2, and GOES CCOR-1. Source is a continuation of the gradual liftoff of the large filament stretching along Latitude N40 in the NW quadrant of the Earth-facing disk as seen in SDO AIA 304.

cmeAnalyses.note: Best fit measurement using several frames of STEREO A COR2 and GOES CCOR-1. One frame of SOHO LASCO C3 used. Some uncertainty due to the leading edge feature tracked being very faint. This CME was partially obstructed by the pylon in SOHO LASCO C3.
Preliminary measurement using fit between SOHO LASCO C3, STEREO A COR2, and GOES CCOR-1.

note: Faint front following in the path and outflow of the CME first seen in SOHO LASCO C2 at 2025-06-26T01:48Z. Also visible in GOES:CCOR-1 and STEREO A COR2. This front appears to be associated with the filament movement and activity along the NW limb in SDO/AIA 304 and 171.

cmeAnalyses.note: Parameters based on best fit and possible source location.

note: Narrow CME seen to the southwest in SOHO LASCO C2/C3, STEREO A COR2, and GOES CCOR-1. Source is uncertain; there is no clear source in available UV imagery of the disk.

cmeAnalyses.note: Best fit measurement using several frames of SOHO LASCO C2/C3 and STEREO A COR2.

note: Narrow, faint CME visible to the west in STEREO A COR2, SOHO LASCO C2/C3, and GOES CCOR-1. There isn't a clear source, but activity visible along the western limb of STEREO A EUVI 304 may be a possible source for this CME.

cmeAnalyses.note: Parameters based on best fit in STEREO A COR2, SOHO LASCO C3, and GOES CCOR-1 imagery.

note: Faint CME first seen to the South in SOHO LASCO C2 beginning at 2025-06-27T11:00Z, as well as in SOHO LASCO C3, GOES CCOR-1 and to the SE in STEREO A COR2. The source of this event is a slow, minor filament liftoff seen beginning at approx. 2025-06-27T04:00Z, centered at approximately S25W15 as seen in SDO AIA and STEREO A EUVI 304, along with field line movement and post eruptive arcades seen in SDO AIA 171, and 193.

cmeAnalyses.note: Measurement based on approximate source location and best fit between SOHO LASCO C2/C3 and STEREO A COR2.

note: CME first seen in the NW by SOHO LASCO C2 beginning at 2025-06-27T12:12Z, as well as by SOHO LASCO C3, GOES CCOR-1 and STEREO A COR2 in later frames. The source of this event is a filament eruption seen along the NW limb (approx. N25W80) as seen in SDO AIA and GOES SUVI 304. Field line movement is also visible in SDO AIA 171, 193 and GOES SUVI 284.

cmeAnalyses.note: Measurement based on approximate source location and best fit in SOHO LASCO C2, STEREO A COR2 and GOES CCOR-1.

note: This CME is visible to the northeast in SOHO LASCO C2/C3, GOES CCOR-1, and STEREO A COR2 imagery. The source is likely related to a minor eruption and subsequent dimming region centered near N28E45 as seen in SDO AIA 193 imagery starting around 2025-06-28T05:30Z.

cmeAnalyses.note: Measurement based on the approximate source location and best fit between SOHO LASCO C2/C3 and STEREO A COR2 imagery.

note: This CME is visible to the south/southeast in SOHO LASCO C2 and to the south/southwest in STEREO A COR2 imagery. Not clearly visible in GOES CCOR-1. The source may be related to a small eruption near Active Region 14123 (S42E02) starting around 2025-06-28T17:30Z as seen in SDO AIA 131, 171, 193, 304 imagery. This eruption exhibits deflection to the southwest, possibly related to the coronal hole which is east of Active Region 14123.

cmeAnalyses.note: Measurement based on the best fit between SOHO LASCO C2 and STEREO A COR2 imagery.

note: CME visible to the SW in SOHO LASCO C2/C3 and GOES:CCOR-1 and to the SE in STEREO A COR2. The source is most clearly seen as field line movement in SDO AIA 171 off the SW limb starting at 2025-06-28T19:06Z. This CME may be associated with dimming east of AR 14117 best seen in STEREO A EUVI 195 and faintly seen around S15W40 in SDO AIA 193 starting around 2025-06-28T18:51Z. Partially overlaps with halo CME: 2025-06-28T21:00Z.

cmeAnalyses.note: Measurement based on potential source location as well as the best fit between SOHO LASCO C2/C3 and STEREO A COR2 imagery. Not clearly measurable with GOES CCOR-1. The CME was only measurable in a few frames of running difference imagery before the leading edge became too faint to measure.

note: CME observed as a faint partial halo, nearly a full halo, directed towards the NW in SOHO LASCO C2, and a brighter front to the NE in STEREO A COR. Also faintly observed in currently available frames of SOHO LASCO C3 and GOES CCOR-1. The source is a C4.0 flare from AR 14126 (N07W22) which peaked at 2025-06-28T19:54Z observed in SDO AIA 131, alongside brightening in SDO AIA 171/193/304 and a small dimming SW of the region best seen in SDO AIA 193.

cmeAnalyses.note: Triangulation with SOHO LASCO C2 and STEREO A COR2 imagery only, as they best observe the faint front with available imagery.

note: Faint CME observed to the NE in SOHO LASCO C2 and GOES CCOR-1, not observed in SOHO LASCO C3 or STEREO A COR2 despite available imagery. No source for this CME is observed in SDO AIA or GOES SUVI imagery.

cmeAnalyses.note: Plane-of-sky measurement with only 3 available frames of SOHO LASCO C2 imagery. CME is deflected northward, thus tracking the front with the swpc_cat tool is difficult.

note: CME visible to the NW in SOHO LASCO C2/C3, STEREO A COR2 running difference imagery, and GOES CCOR-1. The CME is partially obscured by the pylon in SOHO LASCO C3. The potential source is a filament eruption on the NW limb as seen in GOES SUVI 304, with gradual filament liftoff starting around approximately 2025-06-29T10:45Z. Opening field lines also seen in SDO AIA 171/193. Eruption also visible in STEREO A EUVI 195/304. Additional outflowing material may follow this filament eruption.

cmeAnalyses.note: Measurement based on best fit between SOHO LASCO C2, GOES CCOR-1, and STEREO A COR2 in SWPC_CAT. CME not measured in SOHO LASCO C3 because it is obscured by the pylon.

note: CME visible to the NE in SOHO LASCO C2/C3 and STEREO A COR2 running difference imagery. Not clearly visible in GOES CCOR-1. The source is not very clear, but may possibly be a small eruption from AR 14124 (S15E31), best seen as brightening in SDO AIA 193 and GOES SUVI 284 that deflected to the NE. The eruption starts at 2025-06-29T11:15Z.

cmeAnalyses.note: Measurement based on the best fit between SOHO LASCO C2/C3 and STEREO A COR2 in SWPC_CAT, with potential deflection from the source location.

note: Wide bright CME seen to the west in SOHO LASCO C2/C3 and STEREO A COR2A, as well as in GOES CCOR-1 imagery. Its source is a prominent eruption of a long filament off the southwest limb seen in SDO AIA 304/193/171 imagery, as well as in EUVI A 195/304 imagery. The filament appears to be potentially wrapping around the limb in both SOHO and STEREO A instruments, so it is hard to estimate the center of this erupting filament. It looks like the filament breaks up in two parts, one seen almost off the west limb in EUVI A 304, and the other part likely having a lower longitude.

cmeAnalyses.note: Approximate analysis mostly based on the fit with three coronagraphs, but also taking into account that the filament is likely erupting from behind the west limb as seen in SDO AIA.

note: A bright CME seen to the west in all three coronagraphs, which closely follows the 2025-06-29T15:36Z CME and is significantly narrower than this preceding CME. Its source could possibly be the more eastern part of the same filament that produced the 2025-06-29T15:36Z CME, as we see the filament breaking into two parts (this is best seen in STEREO A EUV 304 imagery).

cmeAnalyses.note: Approximate analysis based on the fit with three coronagraphs. The source is not very clear.

note: Bright slow lightbulb CME seen to the northwest in SOHO LASCO C2, STEREO A COR2 and GOES CCOR-1 and partially obscured by the pylon in C3. Its source is a slowly developing high northern latitude filament eruption, best seen as a giant loop centered around ~N35W50 (as seen from Stereo A) in EUVI A 304; its clearest view is at 2025-06-29T18:15Z (but it starts lifting off much earlier).

cmeAnalyses.note: Approximate analysis based on the location of the erupting filament (N35W90), as seen from STEREO A and on the fit with all three coronagraphs.

note: A very faint CME with a faint fuzzy front to the NNW in SOHO LASCO C2, STEREO A COR2 and GOES CCOR-1 and mostly obscured by the pylon in C3, partially overlapping with the slower but brighter 2025-06-29T18:36Z CME. The front of this faint more northern CME is very difficult to trace because of its faintness in any coronagraph other than SOHO. No clear source was found for it, but it might also be connected with the prominent loop-like eruption of the northwestern filament that is happening on/behind the NW limb and which likely produced 2025-06-29T18:36Z CME.

cmeAnalyses.note: An extremely approximate analysis based on the fit of the very faint, difficult to trace front in all three coronagraphs. The source is unclear.

note: This CME is faint but visible to the east/northeast in SOHO LASCO C2/C3 and GOES CCOR-1 imagery. This event is too faint to be observed in STEREO A COR2 imagery. The source is likely far-sided as there are no source signatures on the Earth-facing disk around this time.

cmeAnalyses.note: A plane-of-sky measurement was made using a longitude of -90 degrees due to the far-sided and therefore unknown source location.

note: This CME is visible to the east in STEREO A COR2 imagery. It is not observed in SOHO LASCO C2/C3 or GOES CCOR-1 imagery. The source location is unknown, but may be related to an eruption near Active Region 14122 (N13W05) starting around 2025-06-30T09:15Z as seen in STEREO A EUVI 304 imagery.

cmeAnalyses.note: A plane-of-sky measurement was made with STEREO A COR2 imagery using a longitude of -50 degrees due to the unknown source location. Additionally, this event is not visible in SOHO LASCO C2/C3 or GOES CCOR-1 imagery so a triangulated measurement was therefore unavailable.

note: Loop CME seen to the SW in SOHO LASCO C2/C3, STEREO A COR2, and GOES CCOR-1. One candidate source is the possible partial eruption of a long filament seen in the SW quadrant of the STEREO-A-facing disk. The long filament is seen starting to move at about 2025-06-30T13:45Z with possible partial liftoff of a portion centered at about S20W130 (heliographic coordinates) seen between the STEREO A EUVI 304 frames timestamped 2025-06-30T15:15-15:45Z.

cmeAnalyses.note: Best fit measurement using several frames of SOHO LASCO C2, STEREO A COR2, and GOES CCOR-1. This CME is affected by a data gap in SOHO LASCO C2/C3 from 2025-06-30T17:06Z-19:06Z caused by a scheduled calibration in SOHO LASCO.

note: Narrow CME seen to the SW in SOHO LASCO C2/C3, STEREO A COR2, and GOES CCOR-1. Source is uncertain, but may possibly be subtle field line movement seen from on or beyond the SW limb, at an apparent latitude of about S25, starting around 2025-06-30T17:09Z in SDO AIA 171.

cmeAnalyses.note: Best fit measurement using several frames of SOHO LASCO C3, STEREO A COR2, and GOES CCOR-1. The leading edge becomes diffuse about halfway through the SOHO LASOC C3 field of view.

note: Narrow CME seen to the N in SOHO LASCO C2/C3, STEREO A COR2, and GOES CCOR-1. Source is uncertain, but opening field lines may possibly be seen on or beyond the North limb in STEREO A EUVI when toggling between frames with timestamp 2025-06-30T18:55Z and 19:05Z in STEREO A EUVI 193. These opening field lines may also seen in STEREO A EUVI 304 between frames 2025-06-30T17:45Z and 19:15Z.

cmeAnalyses.note: Best fit between several frames of SOHO LASCO C3 and STEREO A COR2. Partially obstructed by the pylon in GOES CCOR-1.

note: Faint outflow like CME first seen in STEREO A COR2 beginning at 2025-06-30T19:53Z, as well as by GOES CCOR-1 in later frames. This event is not seen in SOHO LASCO C2/C3 due to a data gap beginning at 2025-06-30T20:24Z. There was no clear source seen for this event.

cmeAnalyses.note: Measurement based on best fit between STEREO A COR2 and GOES CCOR-1.

note: Narrow CME seen to the NW in SOHO LASCO C2 (blocked by pylon in C3), STEREO A COR2, and GOES CCOR-1. Source is uncertain; there is no clear source in available UV imagery of the disk.

cmeAnalyses.note: Best fit measurement using several frames of STEREO A COR2 and GOES CCOR-1.

note: This event is visible to the east in STEREO A COR2 imagery. It is not observable in SOHO LASCO C2/C3 or GOES CCOR-1 imagery. The source of this event is unknown and may be far-sided. However, Active Regions 14123 (S28W33) and 14124 (S14W00) exhibit minor brightening starting around 2025-07-01T18:30Z as seen in SDO AIA 193 imagery.

cmeAnalyses.note: A plane-of-sky measurement was made using STEREO A COR2 imagery and a longitude of -44 degrees due to the unknown source location. Additionally, a triangulated measurement was not available as this event was not visible in SOHO LASCO C2/C3 or GOES CCOR-1 imagery.
